newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Aztech unclear scale of copyright damages.
newsitem.headline: Aztech unclear scale of copyright damages.

text.p: Aztech Systems Ltd said on Thursday it had no estimate of its potential liability arising from the assessment of damages in its court case with rival Creative Technology Ltd.
An Aztech statement said the figures of Singapore $20 million to S$40 million referred to in newspaper reports on Thursday were "without any basis".
The statement followed a decision by the Singapore Court of Appeal on Wednesday that Aztech had infringed the copyright of Creative's eight-bit "Sound Blaster" sound card software.
The Appeal Court overturned a previous Singapore High Court ruling which found in favour of Aztech.

Aztech's share price plunged more than 18 percent early on Thursday to a low of Singapore $0.43 on news of the ruling. It last traded at S$0.485 mid-morning before trading was suspended at the company's request.
The company's share price had fallen from a high of S$0.97 earlier this year.
The Aztech statement said the Appeal Court had given the parties three weeks to settle and agree terms of the judgement, if possible.
Aztech declined to comment further on the court's decision.
"The company is currently taking action to ensure that the outcome of this litigation will have no impact on the sale of its existing or future products," it said.
